result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Michael Skipton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Michael Skipton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Michael Skipton was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DE called to obtain his bal. DE was given a current bal of $800.17, but was advised we have not receipted his pymt today yet. DE stated his bal was $800 the last time he called & was advised that he does have interest accruing on his cases due to the missed pymts in the past. DE was also advised that the pymt he made today was for $20 & his pymts are $25/mo, that he will be satisfied for the month of July, but that going fwd, his pymts must be $25 or more. Includes 15CM595, 16FO96, 16FO326, 16FO644. jaf

From DE stating he has a question about his Pymt Plan.  Ret'd call to DE & DE inquired if his short pymt was acceptable. DE to make his pymt, submit a request in writing, or set up an appt to meet w/me to sign a new Pymt Plan by 2-16-18. CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Michael Nieskes DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Christopher Michael Skipton appeared. Case called at 10:05 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference. There is a resolution. ADA Nieskes recites agreement. Has complied with victims rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct without the domestic abuse surcharge in 15CM595. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct without the domestic abuse surcharge in 15CM595. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 1 & 3 in 15CM595. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:

-  Impose 3 days jail. Credit for 3 days. TIME SERVED

- DE may apply for expungement after a period of 1 year from the plea date with the condition of no other criminal charges. Also must complete all financial obligations.  

- $443.00 Court Costs. Set up payment plan

- DNA Sample

Pre-trial conference at 11-10-2015 08:30 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.J.A. or Anita A.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.


Defendant is not to be alone with A.J.A.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Christopher Michael Skipton appeared from jail.  Court confirms address. Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
signed by RMW 9/26/15. eif
